imos
Interface IImos

All Known Implementing Classes:
Imos
public interface IImos

The Intrinsically Motivated Schema mechanism.

Author:
ogeorgeon

Method Detail

step

IAct step(IAct primitiveEnaction)
The main method of the Intrinsic Motivation System. Follow-up the sequence at hand, and chooses the next primitive interaction to try to enact.

Parameters:
primitiveEnaction - The last actually enacted primitive interaction.
Returns:
The primitive interaction to try to enact next.

addPrimitiveAct

IAct addPrimitiveAct(java.lang.String actionLabel,
                     boolean status,
                     int satisfaction)
Create a primitive act and a primitive schema.

Parameters:
actionLabel - The schema's label that is interpreted by the environment.
status - The act's succeed or fail status
satisfaction - The act's satisfaction
Returns:
the created primitive act.

addInteraction

IAct addInteraction(java.lang.String actionLabel,
                    java.lang.String stimuliLabel,
                    int satisfaction)
Constructs a new interaction in episodic memory. or retrieve the the interaction if it already exists. The interaction's action is recorded as a primitive schema. If there is no stimuli, the interaction is marked as the schema's succeeding or failing interaction.

Parameters:
actionLabel - The label of the interaction's action in the environment.
stimuliLabel - The label of the interaction's stimuli generated by the environment.
satisfaction - The interaction's satisfaction.
Returns:
The act that was created or that already existed.

setTracer

void setTracer(ITracer<java.lang.Object> tracer)
Parameters:
tracer - The tracer used to generate the activity traces

getInternalState

java.lang.String getInternalState()
Get a description of the agent's internal state. (for visualization in the environment).

Returns:
A representation of Ernest's internal state
